text: Joseph Leslie Armstrong (27 December 1950 â€“ 20 April 2019) was a British computer scientist. He is best known as one of the co-designers of the Erlang programming language. He was given a Ph.D. in computer science from KTH Royal Institute of Technology (KTH) in Stockholm, Sweden in 2004. He later became a professor at KTH from 2014. He was born in Bournemouth, Hampshire. Armstrong died on 20 April 2019, at the age of 68. ==References== Category:1950 births Category:2019 deaths Category:British computer scientists Category:People from Bournemouth
title: Joe Armstrong (programmer)
